newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian jailed for life after setting boy alight.
newsitem.headline: Australian jailed for life after setting boy alight.

text.p: An Australian charity worker who doused a six-year-old Aboriginal boy with petrol and set him alight was on Thursday sentenced to life in prison.
Paul Streeton, 27, walked into a schoolyard in the northern state of Queensland last October and poured petrol over Tjandamurra O'Shane before setting him on fire.
O'Shane received burns to 60 percent of his body and spent three months in hospital recovering.
Streeton, who pleaded not guilty to attempted murder but guilty on the lesser charge of grievous bodily harm, was sentenced in the Queensland Supreme Court on Thursday.
In an audio tape played to the court, Streeton said he had chosen O'Shane at random as "a sort of payback" for mistreatment he claimed to have received as a child.
Streeton asked not to receive counselling while in prison and was given no set parole period by Judge Margaret White, who handed down the maximum sentence of life.
